message_1: A factory has 3 machines that can complete a task. Machine A can complete the task in 2 hours, machine B can complete the task in 4 hours, and machine C can complete the task in 6 hours. The factory wants to complete the task as quickly as possible, so they want to schedule the machines optimally. What is the minimum amount of time it would take to complete the task?
message_2:
To find the minimum amount of time it would take to complete the task, we need to determine the combined work rate of all three machines working together.

Machine A can complete the task in 2 hours, so its work rate is 1/2 task per hour.
Machine B can complete the task in 4 hours, so its work rate is 1/4 task per hour.
Machine C can complete the task in 6 hours, so its work rate is 1/6 task per hour.

Now, we add up the work rates of all three machines:
(1/2) + (1/4) + (1/6) = (6 + 3 + 2) / 12 = 11/12 tasks per hour.

Since the combined work rate is 11/12 tasks per hour, it would take 1/(11/12) hours to complete the task, which is equal to 12/11 hours.

Therefore, the minimum amount of time it would take to complete the task with all three machines working together is 12/11 hours, or approximately 1.09 hours.
